questions.question: When are you allowed to leave the shop?
Which of the following is not allowed in the shop?
Approved safety glasses or goggles must be worn when?

choices.answer: At all times unless other protective equipment is required

questions.question: Students must not rush shop work because it can lead to_____________?
Shop clothing is unsafe if it is _____________?
Students should notify the instructor immediately in case of____________?
At the end of class, the shop should be_________________?

choices.answer: Cleaned and all tools returned to the proper place

questions.question: While performing work in the shop, students should not______________?
Students should never ____________ while working in the shop.
Loud noises in the shop could cause others to be ______________ ?
It tools and/or equipment become defective, students should ______________?

choices.answer: Put an out of order sign on them

questions.question: Before using power tools, beginner students should always ________________?

choices.answer: Stop and think your actions through
Find someone else to do it

questions.question: If a visitor comes into the shop, students should___________?

choices.answer: Issue them a pair of safety glasses

questions.question: Long Hair, loose clothing, jewelry, and long sleeves need what kind of attention?

choices.answer: Sleeves don't matter, everything else tucked in
Hair pulled back, but sleeves are fine
Hair, jewelry, sleeves are tucked in or removed

questions.question: It is the responsibility of every student to learn to work in a safe manner.
The student must pay strict attention to their work to ensure safety.
Common sense and good judgement will avoid most accidents.
Guards and safety devices will give 100 percent protection against accidents in using machines.
Students not using proper safety precautions should be required to take further shop safety.
It is your responsibility to report all injuries and accidents.  No matter how small.
You should not talk to another student while they are operating a machine.
When clean up time is announced, hurry and get your stuff finished.
Loose or torn clothing can cause serious accidents.
Goggles should be worn when doing work that chips, sparks, or splatters.
Students should not touch electrical devices of any type when their hands or feet are wet.
Machines in good condition can be operated when Mr. Zarza is not in the room.
Wrenches and other tools should be removed from machines before they are powered on.
Machines should be allowed to come to a full stop before adjustments are made.
Loose neckties, loose sleeves, loose aprons must be secured or removed before working.
All students not operating a machine should stay out of the machine area.
Use guards on all machines or do the work by hand.
Fire extinguishers are not an important tool to have in the shop.
Any person who engages in horseplay will receive disciplinary action.
Safety glasses are not mandatory if you are just visiting the shop.
When are you allowed to leave the shop?
Use _______________ while using loud tools.
Keep area _______ at all times.
Never touch a _________ pipe or object while operating any power tool.
Place oily rags in a (an) __________.
Only the _________ should turn on the machine he or she is using.
Know the location of the _________, _________, _________ and how to use them.

choices.answer: Eye Wash Station; Fire Blanket; Fire Extinguisher

questions.question: Use the __________ to complete a job safely, quickly, and efficiently.
When guards are missing, you should _________ continue using the tool and _________.
Always __________ on power tools when adjusting or changing blades, bits or doing maintenance.
Always ________ your wood or metal to the drill press table before drilling.
Always wear _________ around power tools.
Power tools can be extremely dangerous if used _________.
When power tools are cracked or damaged, you should _________ and __________.

choices.answer: Plug it in; Dip it in water
Tag out of service; Tell Instructor

questions.question: The most important shop rule is that you are responsible for your own __________.
Make sure all _________ are in place before using all power tools.
You should not wear ______ ______ while in the shop area.
If you are operating a machine, stay ______________.
Never stand in ____ while operating a power tool.
Be sure tools are stored in a proper tool ___________.
What does PPE Stand for?
How often must the work shop must be swept?

choices.answer: Whenever Harry P. leaves his broom
Every day,when told to do so by a mentor, and as needed

questions.question: What shoes are STRICTLY forbidden?
When is eye protection required?

choices.answer: In the shop & all posted areas

questions.question: What items should be readily available whenever you are working with batteries?

choices.answer: A box of bicarbonate of soda
Acid resistant rubber or plastic gloves

questions.question: What does MSDS mean?
You can operate a machine without the instructor's permission after demonstrating proficiency.
You don't need to report small injuries to your instructor.
Sawdust and metal debris may be just as slippery as spilled liquid, oil ,or grease.
Carry sharp tools and pointed tools next to your body with the points facing ___________.
Always cut _______________ from yourself, when using chisels and other sharp edge tools.
Roll up loose ____ and tie up long ____ while working in the shop
What can happen if you distract someone who is working?

choices.answer: You may cause them to be injured
You will make a new friend

questions.question: It's okay to hold tools in your pocket.
PPE is always optional in the shop area
What Room number are you in?
Always sweep away metal chips with __________
Which of the following are General Causes of Accidents in the wood shop?
In nearly all cases, mistakes and/or injuries are due to operator error, not the machine.
Always clean your machine while its running because it will give you cleaner results.
Dull tools are not dangerous.
The person ultimately responsible for your safety in the shop is:
When using a drill you should?

choices.answer: Make sure all drill bits are dull before using
Check the expiration date on the drill before using.
Observe all physical and electrical safety concerns.
Poke your tongue with the drill to make sure it is sharp

questions.question: What is wrong with baggy pants in the shop?

choices.answer: Its fine as long as you look cool
Its unprofessional and a safety hazard for falling
Its only allowed if you are wearing a really long shirt
Its a health hazard for those near you

questions.question: Why are open-toe shoes not allowed?

choices.answer: Because they are a safety hazard
Because somebody might finesse your shoes

questions.question: If your instructor asks you to change a behavior, or do a procedure safer you should:

choices.answer: Find an excuse to do what you want
Listen and know the instructor has safety concerns

questions.question: Students will not operate machines until:

choices.answer: You’ve studied it in class & had an instructor demonstration
Student passes a safety test on the machine
Instructor is in the room and has given permission

questions.question: Do not play around in the shop! The shop area is the wrong place to fool around because:

choices.answer: It keeps others from doing their work.

questions.question: Which statement is true?

choices.answer: Only the person operating the machine may start and stop it.
You should leave the machine running for the next person.
It doesn't matter who pushes the buttons to start and stop.

questions.question: Yanking on the cord can cause a short or a fire. The safe way to disconnect a power line is to:
Something large or something heavy should be carried:
If there were a fire in the shop you should:

choices.answer: Grab the fire extinguisher and use it
Exit the building and gather in a group with your instructor
Get help with the fire extinguisher

questions.question: Someone could bump into an open cabinet drawer or door. Drawers and cabinet doors should be:
When you hand off a tool to someone, put it down or hold it so that they can:

choices.answer: Take the point or edge first
Catch it as you toss it

questions.question: So they won't get bumped into or tripped over, tools that you're finished with should be:

choices.answer: Put away in the proper location
Left out so the next person will pick them up
Passed to the person next to you

questions.question: Jewelry may be worn as long as it's not ugly
It's OK to use drugs while working in the shop as long as you have a prescription for them
The OSHA Standard "29 CFR 1926.501 (a)(c)     The "CFR" means
The Load capacity of a TYPE I ladder is:
The Load capacity of a TYPE IA ladder is:
The Load capacity of a TYPE II ladder is:
The Most Dangerous Power Tool is:
The point of operation is where

choices.answer: the work is actually performed on the material

questions.question: Guard circular saws:

choices.answer: above and below the base of operation
above and below the base plate or shoe
above the base plate or shoe
below the base plate or shoe

questions.question: A Table Saw should always be equipped with a
Always use compressed air for cleaning
On the Bandsaw, you should adjust the blade guards to within _____” to ______” of the stock.
It's OK for you to cut round stock on the Bandsaw
On the Bandsaw, If the blade comes out of the guides or breaks:

choices.answer: grab the blade with your hand to stop it
run around screaming "We're all going to Die!!"
stop the machine immediately by turning off the power.
don't worry, be happy and keep cutting

questions.question: When cutting with any power saw, you should keep your hand directly in line with the blade
Use a “Push-Stick” NOT your hands to push stock through the saw
Kickbacks occur when the

choices.answer: Politician gives a job to a contractor for money back
blade catches the stock and throws it back at the operator

questions.question: On the Table Saw, the blade should stick up no more than______” above the wood
On the Table Saw, you should make sure __________________ before changing the blade

choices.answer: the saw is plugged in and running
the saw is plugged in but turned off
the saw is unplugged and / or the power is locked out

questions.question: On a Communication Tag or Sign, the colors Blue and White indicate:
On a Communication Tag or Sign, the colors Yellow and White  (or Black) indicate:
On a Communication Tag or Sign, the colors Red and White  (or Black) indicate:
On a Communication Tag or Sign, the colors Green and White  indicate:
Horseplay is OK as long as nobody is operating a power tool
The Sound Level for a Power Lawn Mower is
The Sound Level for a Hand Power Drill is
The Sound Level for a Spray Painter is
The Sound Level for a Hammer Drill is
Of the Five High Hazards, the highest percentage is from:
A screwdriver is a Hammer, and a Hammer is a Screwdriver
Three examples of Hearing protection are - Ear Plugs, Ear Muffs, and:
Mostly Protect from the front
Best to use when working with chemicals
Whose responsible to Provide PPE
Whose responsible to use PPE in accordance with training received
Whose ultimately responsible for the student's safety
Which OSHA Standard does not apply to us in the shop?
You should always try to catch a cutting tool or knife that you drop
What does OSHA mean?
Students shall be responsible for the safe condition of tools and equipment used by students
The Instructor shall be responsible for the safe condition of tools provided by students
The wooden handles of tools shall be kept free of __________ or __________
Which of these is NOT a common injury from working with hand and power tools?
Do NOT Use:

choices.answer: A Hammer with a cracked handle

questions.question: When using Cutting or Slicing tools, which of these should you NOT do:

choices.answer: Put it away in a safe place / manner
Test the blade sharpness with your thumb or finger

questions.question: Safety shoes protect your:
Ear Plugs protect your:
A Face Shield protects your:
It does not matter if you tie up or roll up long hair in the shop
Do not wear loose clothing, dangling objects or jewelry when working in the shop or with tools
